description: The Capital Subsidy scheme in Tamil Nadu provides financial assistance to Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) for modernization and expansion by subsidizing the cost of plant and machinery. The scheme aims to enhance productivity and competitiveness of MSMEs in the state.
key_features: Subsidy on capital investment for plant and machinery
Support for modernization and technology upgradation
Encourages industrial growth in Tamil Nadu

benefits.subsidy: 25% subsidy on the cost of plant and machinery, subject to a maximum of Rs. 30 Lakhs
benefits.additional_incentive: 5% additional subsidy for enterprises in backward areas or owned by women/SC/ST

business_criteria: Must be a registered MSME as per the MSME Development Act, 2006
Must be located in Tamil Nadu
operational_criteria: Investment in new plant and machinery for manufacturing or service sectors
Must comply with Tamil Nadu Industrial Policy guidelines

eligible_activities: Purchase of new plant and machinery for modernization

steps: Visit the Tamil Nadu MSME portal or Industries Department website
Register and submit an online application with details of the investment
Upload required documents, including MSME registration and investment details
Applications are reviewed by the District Industries Centre (DIC)
Approved applicants receive the subsidy upon verification
application_process.note: Applications must be submitted within one year of investment

special_notes: Additional incentives are available for women, SC/ST entrepreneurs, and units in backward areas
Subsidy is disbursed after verification of investment
MSMEs must adhere to environmental and regulatory norms
